item.title: Geeze, they are still talking about Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: I cannot believe that people from the team across the hallway are still talking about Microsoft! I mean it’s reasonable to discuss about it while it was uncertain so I didn’t complain even a little 3 weeks back as they need to communicate to make sure they are getting the right deal from Microsoft. However, [...]
item.content:encoded:
I cannot believe that people from the team across the hallway are still talking about Microsoft!

I mean it’s reasonable to discuss about it while it was uncertain so I didn’t complain even a little 3 weeks back as they need to communicate to make sure they are getting the right deal from Microsoft. However, since they’ve decided sign/not sign, they should get themselves prepared for moving to Microsoft or staying here.

Anyway – I’m abnormal for almost all the cases related to career, so my feeling could be weird.

item.title: IT on screen
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: IT guy (actually I believe it’s an IT gal) is working on my laptop now to get MS Office fixed, it seems the problem came across from an accident upgrade or patch. Anyway, this kind of upgrade is really bothering – why do they need original installation disc while upgrading/patching? Weird. I’m still waiting here, [...]
item.content:encoded:
IT guy (actually I believe it’s an IT gal) is working on my laptop now to get MS Office fixed, it seems the problem came across from an accident upgrade or patch.

Anyway, this kind of upgrade is really bothering – why do they need original installation disc while upgrading/patching? Weird.

I’m still waiting here, seems it takes about 30 minutes to install it, and to make the environment clean, the orignal installation has to be removed followed by a reboot, so overall it takes about an hour.

Maybe it’s time to ask for a new and powerful laptop.

Posted by Wordmobi

item.title: Microsoft stopped offering free domain
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: Got a mail from MSN saying that they are going to stop offering free domain (registration and hosting) which comes from Windows Live. It says I need to pay $15 a year to get private registration, hosting, and something else, I guess I don’t want it so just let it be. Actually I believe Microsoft [...]
item.content:encoded:
Got a mail from MSN saying that they are going to stop offering free domain (registration and hosting) which comes from Windows Live.

It says I need to pay $15 a year to get private registration, hosting, and something else, I guess I don’t want it so just let it be.

Actually I believe Microsoft was wasting money – I register a domain a while back but never used it, at all.
